content.description: Start on the giant jugg-slot thing on the right face of the boulder. Stay low and traverse left until you're directly below the bulge. Figure out your feet whether you can see them or not and tackle the bulge head on to be rewarded with an easy topout.If anyone has any information on what the route name is, FA, etc, please leave a comment and I'll update the page.
content.protection: pad and maybe a spotter to move it.
content.location: To the right of Captain Crunch, go around the corner of the boulder and you'll see a juggy slot with great feet to start the problem.

content.description: Smooth traverse along rail of pockets.  Keep from swinging and you are fine.
content.location: Middle of Right boulder.  SDS on low bulge, working to the left along obvious rail.  Staying to the right of large crack.

content.description: crux midway,bomber pockets,really clean thru the climb but dirty top out.in the picture it looks dirty but its clean and dry.
content.location: second set of boulders on the edge of the first.

content.description: Low start to an already established dyno, super burly and shouldery moves up to the ledge where the dyno leads to a relatively easy top out.
content.protection: At least one pad and a good spot, two or three pads if you're climbing solo
content.location: Just to the right of Pvt Benjamin

content.description: Start anywhere on the face of the small boulder sitting next to the light post. Traverse the entire boulder CCW back to the holds you started on. The top of the boulder is off, but any lower steps are in (see picture). Removing the use of any hold which does not have rock above it like the steps would probably bump the grade to V1.I made up the name because I like the alliteration but if anyone knows if this has already been named, please comment and I'll update the page.
content.protection: It's a lowball so you can do it without a pad, but be mindful of falling and potentially hitting the concrete pillar for the lamp post coming around that particular corner.
content.location: This route traverses the 5 foot tall boulder next to the light post in front of the right boulder.

content.description: Techy short problem. Can be done several ways to make it easier or harder.
content.location: From grass entrance: Right boulder, west corner (white face of rock) SUS on crimps chest high.  Works right to easy top-out.

content.description: Overhung start to bulge crux.  Typical problem for Veteran's Park.
content.location: Right boulder, southeast corner. SDS on ledge far east side of overhang face.

content.description: Crux is over the face of the bulge. Left hand crimp and right hand side pull, work feet to jugs then bump left hand to sloper above, right hand on chest level palm side pull, bump left off sloper to the top out
content.location: Ss start on to sloper ledges that side on top of each other. Right side
